item.title: Front garden of 17 Tanza Road, 28th November
item.description:
The tree with the sequence number 9 was pruned and many branches have fallen into the front garden of Number 17 Tanza Road. They are blocking the access to the garden and damaging the vegetation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tanza Road, Gospel Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Heavy metal canister abandoned on small tree pit, 28th November
item.description:
Near 201 Graham Road on the north side a 'laughing gas' canister has been dropped on by a small tree. This seems to be an area for this kind of dumping, as I've reported before recently.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Graham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped household rubbish -NOT CLEARED, 28th November
item.description:
Was sent a e mail regarding a previous report saying this was cleared - it is still there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark Park Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bags on pavement outside Bin Room for 15-17 High St, 28th November
item.description:
Bin room is full, and black bags stacked up on the pavement outside. This room has not been cleared for some time. Bags are ripped open overnight, and contents strewn over pavement. ,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Crampton Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Refuse left in the road by the refuse collector on Ghursday morning which after foxes have exposed soiled incontinence pants approximately 10 in number., 28th November
item.description:
Outside number 30 Den Road a big white plastic bag was dropped by the Thursday morning waste collectors (non recyclable rubbish). Bag further disturbed by foxes overnight which has meant that about 10 soiled incontinence pants are now on the road. A party of Highfield Junior School kids walked passed on their way to Shortlands Library this morning. I live opposite and have cleaned as much as I can. The last few bits need to be removed and the area cleaned please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Den Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large open bag - fly tipped, 28th November
item.description:
Large open black bag with rubbish spilling out onto path. Risk of vermin etc
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 160, Palmerston Road, Palmers Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small manhole cover wedged wrong, trip hazard, 28th November
item.description:
This little round cover is wedged in a position which makes it a trip hazard, with a 1-2 inch protrusion. An elderly person can easily trip up here. Please fix as a matter of urgency.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Boleyn Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of enforcement of zebra crossing, 28th November
item.description:
Motor vehicles frequently drive through when pedestrians are on the zebra crossing, as there is no enforcement and pedestrian traffic is often high, making car wait times long. Pls enforce in the short term, and consider installing a puffin crossing.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Green Lanes, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disgusting rubbish and smells., 28th November
item.description:
Rubbish all over the footpath and in the road.trip hazard for elderly people. Paving slabs raised by tree roots. Drain holes in road blocked by debris.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Blithdale Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover rocking, dangerous trip hazard, 28th November
item.description:
Last night I had to help an elderly man that stumbled on this manhole cover and very nearly hit his head on the pavement. He lost his glassses and was very shaken. Please fix this as a matter of urgency. It’s on the pavement near the Little Duck Picklery.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dalston Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cabinets and glass waste, 28th November
item.description:
Added to daily been there for 2 weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanworth Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping on Albion Road back of 21-22 Lynsted Close, 28th November
item.description:
Someone has dumped about 5 - 6 black sacks and a trolley by the wall at the back of 21-22 Lynsted Close on Albion Road. The foxes have torn the bags apart so there is now rubbish strewn over the pavement. Please can this be cleared asp.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken concrete lifting in pavement, 28th November
item.description:
Since the lampost has been replaced on the road, there is a large amount of damage to the concrete outside my driveway. This is a trip hazard and could cause damage to any cars pulling in an out of my driveway. The issue has been noted in the past few weeks since work was done on the road to replace all lamposts and has got worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stone Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bike, 28th November
item.description:
This bike has been broken and chained to the bike parking in front to 118-120 Streatham High Road for months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingscourt Road, Streatham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaf clean, 28th November
item.description:
Morning! We did not get our planned leaf clean this month I don’t think. There is a huge amount of leaf mulch on the path and road making it difficult to get by in wheelchairs and prams. Could we please get a leaf pick soon?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Holmdene Avenue, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
